701135f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 151st Street (East)
701135f-a.text:
Grand Concourse (vantage point, not seen), west side, between East 151st and 153rd Streets, showing a view, in a northwesterly direction, of the New York Central Railroad tracks. Also shown are: Walton Ave. orossing the tracks over the bridge, the Bronx Municipal Terminal market
(left background), and the Yankee Stadium (right).
May 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

700145f-a.title: Bronx: 151st Street (East) - Cedar Lane
700145f-a.text:
East 151st Street, north side, west from Cedar Lane to Walton Ave. The G.W. Bromley map of 1923, as revised to September 1932 shows the site to be occupied by a large 7-story apartment house, bearing No. 175.
May 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
